dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2884 IH: Communications Over Various Feeds Electronically For Engagement Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Quigley introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend section 2201 of title 44, United States Code, to require the preservation of Presidential social media accounts, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Communications Over Various Feeds Electronically For Engagement Act of 2017 or the COVFEFE Act of 2017.

section.header: Requirement for preservation of social media accounts
section.text: Section 2201 of title 44, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting social media, after films,;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking ; but and inserting a semicolon;
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following new subparagraph:
includes any personal and official social media account; but
in subparagraph (C), as so redesignated, by inserting after (ii) personal records the following: , except as provided for in subparagraph (B); and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

The term social media means any form of electronic communication (such as a website for social networking and microblogging) through which users create an online community to share information, ideas, personal messages, and other content (such as videos).
